title: where can i make two players banned?
body: like these two said they were gonna duo jungle. when they tried to steal enemy blue i said ''gg duo jungle'' and then they went mid went free kills for enemy midlaner jinx and stole all my farm so i really could not enjoy this game a single bit. she had 17/0 in under 7 mins. please where can i make sure these two get banned? they accaused me for saying racist and nazist stuff to them like wth

replies.body:
In the post game lobby, there is a report button. Select the category or categories that most accurately apply, and leave a description if you feel the context would be helpful in a manual review.

When a player is accusing you of behavior you didn't do, Mute them and don't worry about it. Reports against you for behavior you did not commit will not result in a punishment. As long as you don't respond to it with negative behavior and validate their reports you'll be fine.
i know how to report but i have learned after 5 years that riot never do anything. i want them actually banned

> i know how to report but i have learned after 5 years that riot never do anything. 

You literally got 2 messages 5 minutes after that game informing you that a player you reported was penalized. The report system works. It just takes a brief read through these forums to see evidence of such.

> i want them actually banned

That's not how it works. There is no way to can get players banned. Their own behavior determines whether or not they receive a penalty.

As an FYI, going AFK will be held against you, regardless of the circumstances. In situations like this in the future, just mute the players and report after the game. Engaging them in conversation will do nothing more than encourage them to troll if that is their intent.

Hi, do you mind if I hijack the discussion to ask you a question about the report notifications?

95% of my reports are targeted at bots / ppl botting, but I don't remember ever getting a notification telling me said accounts were penalized.

* 1- is this normal?

* 2- does this weight against me, since none of my reports are -validated- by the system (and thus the system must think all my reports are bs)

* 3- am I wasting my time reporting bots (usually for a combination of cheating / intentionally feeding / afk / leaving)

Thank you.

1 - yes, this is normal. You only get notifications on penalties related to your reports for verbal abuse and intentional feeding currently.

2- No, there are no report 'weights' anymore.

3- No, bot reports are used. You are certainly not wasting your time.
What are your thoughts on expanding notifications to other report categories

What are your suggestions and reasoning?

We've intentionally narrowed it down to meaningful groups that we think encapsulate most behaviors that would warrant/require reporting.
I think I would like to receive a notification that my report was useful anytime my report was used. It can feel discouraging to report bots and not receive feedback that it was useful.

from what I'm reading from (the very few) comments, they want to expand the reporting category to **"make it more clear what is punishable"**

Such as:

* role stealing 
* kill stealing (people crying for nothing)
* CS / jg camp stealing (people crying for even lesser things)
* trolling (those are typically complaining about that teemo support)
* toxic in pre/post game chat (those that don't know that you guys see it already)
* AFK @ fountain or AFK in jg (somehow they don't know that reporting that in the AFK category works)
* asking for reports (as a harassment tool)
* giving up 

**These typically just come from people not understanding how the system works**, and they are just following very precise instructions instead of using generalised descriptions.
"Kill stealing + Cs stealing" - We dont need more reasons for bronzies to yell at eachother.
I'm not saying those are punishable, I'm just telling tantram what some people wrote within the past few months.

I second spideraxe's notion of reporting champ select trolls. This requires the ability to report after someone dodges, which is common in this case. There is no easy way to report this behavior. 

Passive aggressive ??????????? pinging is also a behavior that should be somehow reported. I usually report it as unsportsmanlike but i'm not sure if that's the best way to categorize it. 

Also someone who constantly picks fights irrespective of any form of context (wards, enemy strength, etc...) can be hard to distinguish from intentional feeding sometimes. For example the 3/3/1 top laner might flame the 0-5-2 mid laner a bit, and then proceeds to silently pick 7 bad fights in a row and i can't tell if he's inting to get back at the mid laner out of frustration or just bad at teamfights. Sometimes it feels wrong to report that for inting because its not 100% clear on his intentions. iirc the old "unskilled player" was a placebo button but this category and its functionality could be revisited.
Maybe something like inappropriate name or like aito locking in champ select can added to within those circles, imo that feels like griefing or flaming in their own respects

Is the answer to #2 still true? Recently updated FAQ seems to say otherwise. More about the matter [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/1vUGoiuQ-riot-report-weigth-does-it-exist-or-not).

> [{quoted}](name=cocacolalips,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4ZhxeyVg,comment-id=0002000000020000,timestamp=2017-04-07T00:10:46.265+0000)95% of my reports are targeted at bots / ppl botting, but I don't remember ever getting a notification telling me said accounts were penalized.
>
>is this normal?

Yep. Current functionality is (to my knowledge) that you get the notification if and only if your report is the one that triggers the punishment. Otherwise your report goes into the bucket of reports against that player, where it still helps to eventually trigger a punishment but does not notify you directly.

> but does not notify you directly.

We're trying to get this changed, but it requires LCU resources, which are unlikely to be free any time soon.

Riot believes most players would find the alert annoying if it were for every suspension and suspects the people asking for the feature are a small minority.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4ZhxeyVg,comment-id=000200000002000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-07T00:29:45.324+0000)> Riot believes most players would find the alert annoying if it were for every suspension and suspects the people asking for the feature are a small minority.

I'm personally inclined to agree on the potential for that to be really irritating.

It feels like the optimal solution might be if resources are ever free to create a part of the client that serves as a "toxic players identified" section, where you can check to see the total number of times your reports have had an effect, as well as the number of times since you last checked. Something that might display, for example, ***"120 [+3]*** if you had 120 total reports and 3 since your last check.

Then just put a glow on the button for it (or on another part of the UI) when it updates.

------------------

But yeah. Resources that could be used for other things, and are probably better spent on those other things. :)
no. i got ONE message about ONE player not the second one. and the message came the day AFTER
So why isn't going AFK in 25+ games bannable?

How would you feel if you got banned because those double jungle 'want you _actually_ banned' too?

Truth is we can't just get what we want, because we are biased. If Riot gave every player what they wanted regarding banning of other players then the community would disappear from unjust bans.

1. Did you report them? Good, they may receive a punishment without you being notified if your report was not the report to finally trigger a review for them. Have faith and move on, chances are you won't ever see them again either way.

2. In your future games try not saying negative things about teammates in chat. They won't be toxic towards you if you never trigger them. Toxic in general? Maybe sometimes, but at least not directly towards you.

Then you haven't actually learned anything. If they are truly guilty and show that kind of play over and over, Riot will deal with it. One game doesn't always lead to the outcome of punishment, it all depends upon different circumstances for each match to see what is deemed as a player going too far.

Normally, do what Deep Terror suggests. However, if you REAAAALLY think it's the worst thing you've ever seen , or you think it won't be visible to the system for whatever reason, use a phone camera to take a picture of your game chat, OR any program on a computer that snaps a picture of your current screen (I've never used one but I know they exist). Then you send it in to Riot support under I have a question about league of legends/Riot games and general questions.
If you didn't report them in the post game lobby you're out of luck. However if they are like that often then eventually someone will report them.
